ARABIC: فَمَا زَالَت تِّلْكَ دَعْوَىٰهُمْ حَتَّىٰ جَعَلْنَٰهُمْ حَصِيدًا خَٰمِدِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: That cry of theirs went on until We made them stubble, silent, stamped out.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And this remained their lament till We mowed them down and made them extinct.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They did not cease to cry this until We reduced them to stubble, still and silent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Such was what they continued to say until We mowed them down and made them completely extinct.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So they kept saying this until We made them cut off, extinguished.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is reaped, extinct.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And this ceased not to be their cry till We made them cut off, extinct.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So they ceased not to cry, until We made them stubble, silent and still.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And this their crying ceased not till We made them as reaped corn, extinct.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and this they kept repeating until We caused them to become like a field mowed down, and reduced to ashes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And this ceased not to be their cry until We made them a harvestreaped, extinguished.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: That remained their cry until We turned them into a mown field, stilled [like burnt ashes].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is mown, as ashes silent and quenched.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And that cry of theirs ceased not, till We made them as a field that is reaped, extinct (dead).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And this they did not stop crying out until We made them stubble, silent, and still.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: This continued to be their cry, until We made them silent ashes.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [21:15] So that, saying, remained their cry, which they would make and repeat, until We made them as reaped [crops], as crops harvested with sickles when they were killed with the sword, stilled, dead, like the stillness of fire when it is extinguished.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And this their crying) i.e. saying "Alas for us!" (ceased not till We made them as reaped corn, extinct) dead, motionless. This is the story of a township near Yemen called "Hudur". Allah sent a prophet to them but they killed him. Allah set on them Nebuchadnezzar who exterminated them.
